definition: to jump/way of stroke in calligraphy
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
surname Di/variant of 狄[Di2], generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)

sentences.english: Compiling ga dictionary is an awful sweat.
sentences.chinese: 編詞典是趯極其喫力的苦差。

definition: vertical stroke with a hook at the end (in Chinese characters)
to bleed from the nose (or from the ears, gums etc)/fig. to be defeated
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
horizontal stroke with a hook at the end (in Chinese characters)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
